body.name: White Label WL 4TB 7200RPM 64MB Cache SATA 6.0Gb/s (Enterprise Grade) 3.5" Hard Drive (for Server, RAID, NAS, DVR, Desktop PC) w/1 Year Warranty
body.stockDetail: Only 3 left in stock - order soon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 17 hrs 23 mins
features: Industry's highest capacity nearline drive - SATA III (6.0Gbs) Enterprise hard drives are available in capacities 4TB to suit even the most demanding storage needs
Highest performance for business-critical applications - delivers 6 Gb/s transfer rates, sustained sequential data rates of 171 MB/s and high random I/O rates

Designed for quality and reliability - With a field-tested 1.2 million hour MTBF, this high performance drive delivers the highest level of reliability for 24x7 operation in up to 100% duty cycle applications

Dual processor - Twice the processing power to maximize performance Vibration Protection - Enhanced RAFF technology includes sophisticated electronics to monitor the drive and correct both linear and rotational vibration in real time.
body.description: This is a White Label (4-Terabyte) 4TB SATA3 hard drive featuring with 7200RPM, 64MB cache SATA 6.0Gb/s(Enterprise Grade) hard drive with 1 year warranty. A white label product is a product made by major hard drive company that manufactured for other companies (OEM Hard Drive Reseller/VAR) re-brand to make it appear as if they made it or for large volume special application. Industry's highest capacity nearline drive - SATA hard drives are available in capacities 4 TB to suit even the most demanding storage needs. Highest performance for business-critical applications - delivers 6 Gb/s transfer rates, sustained sequential data rates of 171 MB/s and high random I/O rates. Designed for quality and reliability - With a field-tested 1.2 million hour MTBF, this high performance drive delivers the highest level of reliability for 24x7 operation in up to 100% duty cycle applications. Dual processor - Twice the processing power to maximize performance. Enhanced RAFF technology includes sophisticated electronics to monitor the drive and correct both linear and rotational vibration. The result is a significant performance improvement in high vibration environments over the previous generation of drives.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 475 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great price for a NAS HDD
reviews.reviewText: Great HDD for a truenas or unraid setup, bought one a couple weeks ago and it worked perfectly right out of the box. Shipping was fantastic as well. Made it across the country in 2 days.EDIT: 2nd one of these I bought has bad sectors on truenas and unraid after 2 days of use. Will update as return unfolds. Still a good value for the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I know in this day and age mechanical drives are pretty much a thing of the past, but i needed extra storage and i needed it for cheap!! These fit the bill... Got 3 of these and they worl perfectly so far. 2 of them are in a server machine as part of a storage pool and the other i use externally to back up copies of VMs.Cant complain!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Bought 5 of these end of 2021, had them in my Synology NAS. One of them had SMART critical warning on Sep 2022, still working by the time I see the warning. Emailed and processed a quick warranty replacement, down side is you have to pay for send it back, but turnaround time was less than a week, very quick, great service. For QNAP owners, when I had them tested in QNAP, it was unacceptable loud even when idle. Then I found out if you mount these drives with screws instead of using just quick snap mounts, they make much less noise because less vibration between drives and trays. For Synology there is no way to mount with screws(at lease my DS1621+), but somehow Synology managed to have less vibration using just quick snap mounts, no problem so far, other than full load, 5 drives are very quiet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So far so good
reviews.reviewText: I bought this to replace a failing 2TB external drive I use exclusively for local backups, and to test to see if these are good candidates for replacing my IronWolf's in my RAID5 array on my SOHO server (when they fail).It's been about 2 weeks, and it's working fine so far. I did a full dd wipe before mounting, and no errors or bad sectors. However, I found it odd that in smartmontools, the drive doesn't report '187 - Reported Uncorrectable' or '188 - Command Timeout' stats, which are 2 of the 5 attributes I monitor (per Backblaze) to indicate pending failure.At half the price, I could replace these twice as often as the IronWolf's and still come out even. But without the stats, I feel like I'm half in-the-dark about drive health. So... still undecided.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Didn’t realize 4TB would hold so much information. Holds everything I have with plenty of room for the future. A little loud but no problem for my situation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 2 years in & The Honest Truth
reviews.reviewText: I've purchased 8 of these drives at various times and at various prices in last 3 years and have yet to see a failure (surprisingly). 4 of them are in my NAS system running 24/7. The other 4 I keep on hand for spares or migrations/expansions. To be honest, I was expecting more problems when I purchased them or for them to be discontinued (hence the extra's) but ya, they're great... and still sold 3 years later... so the honest truth is these are awesome drives at rock bottom prices and I fully plan on purchasing more. This is the best kept secret. I didn't want to leave this review because I wanted to keep it that way but its the right thing to do so you're welcome.More details:- As far as I can tell, they are new drives, not renewed. They all came packaged well and unopened.- They get the expected 170 MBps seq read/write for a 7200 RPM drive.- They do get toasty if left unchecked, however I run them in a well ventilated enclosure in a cold basement so I don't have any thermal issues.- Despite having a White-Label, doing a deeper dive shows that all the drives I got are actually HGST. Some of them literally have HGST model number in the stats (see bottom one in the screenshot), but the firmware running on the others leads me to believe that they are also HGST/Western Digital. Because these are White-Label tho, nothing is certain.- A few of the drives are only rated at SATA II despite saying SATA III on the page. Really tho - that doesnt matter. A hard disk can never SATA III speeds anyways. Just an oddity I noticed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Noisy and slow
reviews.reviewText: I think it’s about to die. Do not worth the effort

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars L O U D
reviews.reviewText: First of all I have owned a lot of enterprise drives and Nas drives over the years so I'm well versed in hard drive sounds. So let me tell ya, these drives are the LOUDEST hard drives on planet earth. I could place them in a welding shop and still hear them clunking away in the background. That's how loud they are. Do not put these in a bed room unless you can sleep through a marching band. Also the vibration is crazy when it's finding data. No idea how long they'll last but if the sound is any gauge, not even a year.Might remember to update the review when they fail. If they last 2 years I'll consider myself lucky.
